title: (x) Daily Candy - HTF Requiem {Billy, Eduardo}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516050745im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26876.jpg)   
This font is used on papyrus logo as well, but this was the example I could find. Used also across dailycandy.com website.   
What it is?
author: mncz

comments.content: Looks like Hoefler's [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516050745/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/requiem/charset.html) with a modified N.
It's the small caps I think.
As my link above indicates, the special characters are available in both regular and small caps. How can you tell which it is? Weight? I don't have the font.

Right, I didn't click on your link.   
   
I just got excited and posted.
As I read it, the alternate charaacters are in both the capital and small caps fonts (per the printed catalog I am looking at from HTF).
Ooops. Sorry William, I guess you already covered that.
